channel.title: Co-Op still can be played!
channel.description:
Im pretty sure with SOME console commands such as,
sv_lan
sv_region
That max players command.
I remembered there was a command that made two copys of weapons appear (so if you picked up a crowbar, there still is one left for a friend)
Dont flame me about co-op, I am not butthurt about it being gone.

item.title: Co-Op still can be played!
item.dc:creator: therandus
item.description:
MysticJ:

Touche…

Question: How are they going to apprehend both Gordon and the buddy in Apprehension, if Gordon steps into the room and the buddy stays outside? How will two people navigate those areas which only allow 1 person to pass through?

easy they have already done it in sven coop, they just both appear in the grabage disposal because either way you just spawn in that map.

I dont know why people are saying it sucks, from what some people have said when they played it for a little bit they played sucky maps because some are lengendary and some creators are awsome at it. Also it is 10 times better when your playing with close friends in a LAN party. Because you can have any map with any game because its relatively easy to create a map in the half life 1 engine. and so you can have a laugh. i have always liked coop because its makes it’s more interesting than being on your own for a whole game.
Of course if you have a jerk with you then its gonna be annoying but thats just common sense.

Read full topic

item.title: Co-Op still can be played!
item.dc:creator: PingWing
item.description:
Is Synergy a good alternative for Co-Op?

All there needs to be done are some settings at the default spawn, and maybe something like allow more players on those carts, and let them respawn.

item.title: Co-Op still can be played!
item.dc:creator: MysticJ
item.description:
Comrade Tiki:

I can’t imagine why so many policemen are assigned to work with partners. I mean, there’s just another guy who could get you entailed in a rodney-king case, or who could accidentally shoot you if he mistakes you for a gun-wielding perp in a vacant building you’re sent to scour, or who could be taken hostage or be injured and become a liability.

I mean, unless your buddy is talented and respectable. Then the benefits of another gun become blindingly obvious. Perhaps someone you trust in real life, instead of a random twelve-year-old stranger on the internet.

In unrelated news, I understand now why the devs have decided to forgo making co-op a priority. It might involve a lack of IRL friends with which to best experience the fruit of their labour.

Touche…

Bloodshot:

A lot of people, me included, would rather play one of their favorite games through with their friends than a game with a thin story and zombie shooting. Sure half-life has zombies, but It’s a more deep and rewarding experience. And if you play it with close friends like I do it usually ends up either we work together, or if we feel like screwing around, we do stupid things because their funny. As fun as a SP game might be, having working coop only enhances the experience.

Question: How are they going to apprehend both Gordon and the buddy in Apprehension, if Gordon steps into the room and the buddy stays outside? How will two people navigate those areas which only allow 1 person to pass through?

Read full topic

item.title: Co-Op still can be played!
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
MysticJ:

I never understood the desire to play COOP through a single-player game.

I mean, the game is already quite difficult and even frustrating even if there’s only you who can possibly screw things beyond all repair. And now, people actually desire to have someone alongside, who will cook grenades beneath their feet, or toggle switches at the wrong time, or provoke aliens they wanted to avoid?

If you want coop, play L4D.

A lot of people, me included, would rather play one of their favorite games through with their friends than a game with a thin story and zombie shooting. Sure half-life has zombies, but It’s a more deep and rewarding experience. And if you play it with close friends like I do it usually ends up either we work together, or if we feel like screwing around, we do stupid things because their funny. As fun as a SP game might be, having working coop only enhances the experience.

Read full topic

I mean, unless your buddy is talented and respectable. Then the benefits of another gun become blindingly obvious. Perhaps someone you trust in real life, instead of a random twelve-year-old stranger on the internet.

item.title: Co-Op still can be played!
item.dc:creator: Solokiller
item.description:
So the fact that they’re still working on SC1 and don’t have all that much experience with the Source engine doesn’t matters then? There are other factors, but i can’t tell you those because they’re not publicly known yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Co-Op still can be played!
item.dc:creator: LED
item.description:
Solokiller:

It is an argument since the SC devs said they wouldn’t make one on the current Source engine, it’s too much work for too little gain, especially when there’s other co-op mods already out there.

In my eyes this just means, that the devs don’t have any innovative ideas for a sequel, so that they need something “new” and “shiny” to hide this fact.

Read full topic

item.title: Co-Op still can be played!
item.dc:creator: Solokiller
item.description:

item.title: Co-Op still can be played!
item.dc:creator: LED
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

I never understood the facination with sven coop

I have to agree with you. I played it several times, but almost every map had a boring and crappy level design and sometimes it’s just a frustrating “die and respawn”.

Solokiller:

Sven co-op 2 won’t be made by the original team, the Source engine is already 6 years old.

This is no argument. There are still people starting HL1 mod projects and for other games that are even older.

etb513:

Exactly. If there will be a Sven Coop 2, it will be with Source 2.0 or whatever Valve’s next engine is.

There will be no “next” engine, as long as Source fits their needs (that’s what Gabe Newell said last time). But there will come great new features with the next Source Engine upgrade (rewritten rendering path, enhanced lighting and so on).

Read full topic
